p: After administration of MECD (50, 100, 200 and 400 mg/kg), a significant ( p < 0.05 , p < 0.01, p < 0.001) dose-dependent delay in the onset of diarrhea produced upon it was compared with the control. Similarly, there was a reduction in the number of wet feces, total number of feces, weight of wet feces and total weight of all feces. The summary of castor oil-induced diarrhea has been shown in Table 2. However, the data revealed that the percentage of diarrhea inhibitions was 22.31%, 38.79%, 58.15% and 80.64% at doses of 50,100, 200 and 400 mg/kg subsequently.
